properties.name: 3d lane runner
properties.description: This 3D lane runner game shows the basics of adjusting a 3D camera, variables, sound effects, saving and loading a highscore, and how to use the platformer behavior in a 3D space.

objects.name: TutorialText
objects.string: Controls: Arrow keys and space bar.

events.comment: Loading the highscore variable in to the game to be used for the CoinScore text object.
Adjusting the tutorial text for a mobile game.
Adjusting the default camera position and some other basic defaults for the game.
Constant camera movement to follow the player.
Collision checks if objects are in the proper lane.
Collision checks if objects are in the proper lane.
Reseting the rising pitch variable after being adjusted in the coin collision event.
Checking which objects are valid after the player changes lanes.
Picking a random layout from the list and creating it ahead of the player.
Deleting objects that go too far behind the player to improve performance.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @e1e5en
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SwipeGesture
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Detect swipe gestures based on their distance and duration.
description: Use the "Enable swipe detection" action at the beginning of your scene.
Note: This extension does NOT support multitouch.
- `Distance`: Length of the swipe, in pixels
- `DistanceX`, `DistanceY`: Distance the swipe moved in each axis
- `Angle`: Direction the swipe moved towards. Range (-180, 180)
- `Layer`: Layer used to detect swipe gestures
- `Is swipe in progress?` - A swipe starts when the mouse click or touch begins
- `Has swipe just ended?` - When the mouse or touch is released, this condition is true for one frame
- `Swipe moved in a direction (4-way movement)` - the direction value for 4 sides (UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT). In this case, the circle is divided into 4 segments of 90 degrees

- `Swipe moved in a direction (8-way movement)` - the direction value for 8 sides (UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT, UP-LEFT, UP-RIGHT, DOWN-LEFT, DOWN-RIGHT). In this case, the circle is divided into 8 segments of 45 degrees.

events.name: Detect if a swipe has ended
Detect if a new swipe started
